Title: libvpx: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
Timothy B. Terriberry discovered that libvpx contains an integer overflow
    vulnerability in the processing of video streams that may allow
    user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: libvpx is the VP8 codec SDK used to encode and decode video streams, typically within a WebM format media file.

Description.Text: libvpx is vulnerable to an integer overflow vulnerability when processing crafted VP8 video streams.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted media file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All libvpx users should upgrade to the latest stable version:

Packages which depend on this library may need to be recompiled. Tools
    such as revdep-rebuild may assist in identifying some of these
    packages.
